dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Chosen to go to the graveyard? Why don't you just take the first runner up, okay?

dialogues.text: Oh, my God. I never told anybody about this. I remember the one http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer about the peasant, too. God, there's a bunch. Is this, like channeling or something. Merrick rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Why didn't you ever tell anybody about your dreams? http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, tell everyone I'm crazy. Beauty ida. Buffy stops, winces slightly.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ow.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Cramps?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: None of your business. God.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: This is it. Buffy is standing on a freshly dug grave. The headstone r "ROBERT BERMAN, 1972 - 1990. GOD IS AT HIS HEELS".

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Robert Berman was killed three days ago. The body was found in the bushes out by the canal. Extensive tissue damage -- tearing -- at the neck and shoulders. Coroner thinks it's a dog. You sit her. He points out a plot of ground about eight feet from the of the grave. Buffy sits and leans against another stone. Merrick reaches into his jacket, pulls out a stake and a hands the cross to Buffy.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Just for protection. You won't have to do anything. I just need you to watch.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: All right. What do we do now? http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: We wait for Robert to wake up. Merrick goes over to the other headstone, crouches by it.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Do you have any gum?

dialogues.speaker: SUNSET
dialogues.text: The last red glimmer disappears behind the hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassandra stands waiting for Buffy. The sun is down, dark increasing. She looks at her watch and gives up, heads fo her car. Her key in the door, she hears a RUSTLING behind her. Looks slowly around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy sits fidgeting. Playing with her fingernails. Merri stays in the position, listening. A low, almost inaudible MOAN come from under the ground. sits up straight, holds the cross to her. The MOAN become louder, almost a scream. The SOUND is followed by the SOU of FINGERS SCRAPPING wood -- of WOOD SPLINTERING -- of di The moaning continues, becoming eerier, somewhat more articulate. Buffy and Merrick wait.

dialogues.speaker: THE GRAVE
dialogues.text: Finally, fingers break through the ground and hold stiff the open air. The moan becomes a triumphant HISS. The fin clutch at the ground. ROBERT BERMAN pops halfway out of his grave like a jack-i box, his face dirty and dead-white. He sees Buffy in fron him, and he bobs toward her with a crazy grin, stretching to a mother's tit. http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Merrick drops down behind Robert and grabs him, raising t stake. Buffy watches, immobilized. A pair of arms shoot up from the ground right under Buffy They grab her and pull her to the ground. Next to her fac the face of another vampire, a YOUNG WOMAN, emerges grinn from the crumbling earth. Buffy screams lustily, and struggles to break free. Merrick is momentarily distracted by this, and Robert thr him off, and pulls himself out of the grave. Merrick fall the ground, and his stake goes flying. Buffy pulls herself out of the girl's grasp, starts runni away, but the girl grabs her. Buffy remembers the cross i her hand, spins and holds it to the vampire's forehead. I burns and the lady lets go, screaming and falling to the

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: "Bye now. Buffy runs.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK AND ROBERT
dialogues.text: They are struggling, several feet away. Robert grabs Merr by the shoulders and picks him up, preparing to bite him. stake suddenly pops out of his chest, planted in his back Buffy. He falls and dies.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Where's the other one?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: She -- It leaps at her, screaming. She throws it off, as Merrick produces another stake and throws it to her. Buffy sticks in the vampire's heart. She dies, screaming, her face sti smoking, blood spurting onto Buffy. Buffy looks at herself. At the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Merrick walks Buffy to the door. She is silent, slow.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Go to school tomorrow. Try to act normal. Don't let anyone know what's happening. This is important. When the vampires find out who you are... you won't be hunting them anymore.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: All right. He hands her a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Meet me at this address after school.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: I have cheerleading squad.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Skip it. Buffy nods. Merrick starts back down the path.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Merrick. Merrick stops.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (continuing) They can't come in, right? Unless you invite them. Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: It's true. Merrick moves on. Buffy goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy shuts the door, turns to go up to her room. She is startled by someone standing in her path. She almost scre http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer It's her mother. She stands, arm akimbo, looking very confrontational. Buffy looks a sight, and stands uncomfor in front of her mother for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY'S MOM
dialogues.text: Do you know what time it is?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Uum... around ten? Mom taps her watch, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY'S MOM
dialogues.text: I knew this thing was slow. She crosses out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY'S MOM
dialogues.text: (continuing) You pay a fortune for something... (calls out) Honey, come on, we're gonna be late. Her mother gone, Buffy lets out a small sigh -- of relief frustration, it is not clear. She heads upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy stands at the sink, washing her shirt. She tries to the blood off with fierce intensity. She is near tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits in the middle of the bed in her pajamas, the bla pooled around her. She cannot sleep. Finally, she lies ba on the pillow. Lothos is beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy walks through the hall slowly, obviously the worse http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer last night's wear. Gary Murray comes up next to her, look at his watch pointedly: she's late for class. He moves on Jeffrey, going the other way, stops next to her.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Hey, baby, how ya doing? You look beat.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: I do? I guess I do.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: Where were you last night? I called your house like four times.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: I went to sleep. I think I have the flu or something. Jeffrey backs away from her.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: I can't get sick. You know -- training and all. I'm gonna be late.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: "Bye. Jeffrey moves off to class. Buffy walks on a bit. She bum into Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Hey, Buffers. You look thrashed.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: You and Cassandra get anything done last night? Buffy looks confused for a moment, then remembers.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Oh. No. She never showed.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA'S FACE
dialogues.text: She is waking up, obviously from being knocked out. She b stupidly, looks around. She is lying by a pool of what lo to be dark water in a large cave. Torches burn around her She tries to get up and finds it difficult. She pulls her up to the side of the pool and splashes water on her face It's blood. She starts, staring with growing horror at her hands. She does not even see the figure rise from the pool at first. It's Lothos. He wears no shirt, only white trousers and b the style maybe Nineteenth Century. No blood seems to tou him as he rises. He looks at Cassandra with an almost sle lust.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: I find it restorative, sleeping in the life-blood of so many. To feel their souls coursing about me.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: What's happening? What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: (smiling) So very much.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: My parents have money...

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm sure they do. This place is everything you said it was, Amilyn. Cassandra turns. Amilyn stands behind her, grinning. He hisses, bares his fangs at Cassandra.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: What... are you?

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: Are we so strange? So alien to http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer you? I've seen this culture, the wealth, the greed, the waste... it's truly heartwarming. The perfect place to spread my empire. Honestly, Eastern Europe was so dead, the Communists just drained the blood out of the place. It's livened up a bit in the past few years, but it's nothing compared to this.... this Mecca of consumption. The city of Angels. He steps right up to her.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: (continuing) What are we? We are man, perfected. We exist to consume. On the world "to consume" we see Amilyn mouthing the word with Lothos, his eyes to the ceiling. He's heard this a h times.

dialogues.speaker: AMILYN
dialogues.text: So? Do we change this one, or do we just drain her? Cassandra pulls her gold card out of her wallet.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: Here, look. My gold card. It's your. I'll never report it. Amilyn snatches it from her, looks it over.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: She has a certain quality, this one... Amilyn bites the card.

dialogues.speaker: AMILYN
dialogues.text: I don't think this is gold.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: Not as single-minded as the others, not as sybaritic. Almost thoughtful. She's useless. http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: No, wait. I can be dumb. Really. Or mean, or whatever. I can learn. I'm useful.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: Swear to God. He rips out her throat, tearing at it with his teeth as b gushes around their faces and she wriggle, twists, dies. hurls her into the door and wipes blood from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: I wish you wouldn't mention him... Slowly Cassandra slides down the wall, her eyes glazing o As she descends we see, stenciled on the wall, "Hemery Hi School. Maintenance Only."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey, dusty and long since abandoned. Sunlight pours in t the large windows, practically caked with dust. Old crate are stacked here and there, bits of manikins leaning on o two. Merrick sits on a crate, reading the newspaper. Buffy enters hesitantly, puts down her bookbag next to a of Merrick's stuff, including a rolled-up sleeping bag. T is definitely not her turf. She runs her finger along a c picks up a world of dust. She holds up her finger at Merr

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Fire the help. No kidding. Merrick looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: It's not pretty, but it does suit our purposes.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Our purposes. http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer She repeats it not with attitude, but a dull wonder at he connection with this strange man. She crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (continuing) What, um... What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: There's a great deal I have to show you, I'm not even sure where to start There's so little time.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Why do you keep saying that?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Do you know what a Vampire-King is?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: A Vampire-King? You mean like Dracula?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. And the man from your dreams. Lothos.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Oh, him.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Yes. They travel about, usually with one or two of their followers to lay the groundwork. The vampires find a community and they feed on it, make it their own. You were difficult to trace, and I think the process has gone a lot further than I'd anticipated. Usually this goads a community into some kind of paranoid frenzy. But for some reason, nobody here seems to be paying any attention.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (not paying attention) what? http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Buffy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: (annoyed) We'll cover it later.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: I still don't get how they happened to come to my town. I mean, was I born here because... because they were coming here? That Lothos guy, and his buddies?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: In a way, yes. Your fate is inexorably connected to them.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Great. First I have a birthright, now I've got a fate. Hey, do I have to take notes on this?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: (put down his paper) We're going to have the work hard. You'll need some excuse for staying out. For your parents.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Not a pressing issue.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: I tell you, the best thing I can do right now is find out more about you. What your strengths are, your likes... Everything. What's your best subject?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Uh... gym.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Yes, you used to do gymnastics. But you stopped. Why?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Well, everybody says... it's just kind of dorky. I mean, have you http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer ever seen a gymnast's legs? They're like -- (indicating huge) -- the mighty oak. It's not a look.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: But you enjoyed it, yes?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Well... I do cheerleading now. It's way cooler.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Cheerleading. For... sporting events, yes?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Sporting events, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: All right. Why don't you show me a cheer?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Here?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. It would be interesting. A nice cheer.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Okay. Buffy starts, a bit awkwardly, doing a cheer.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Who we gonna beat?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: (pathetically following her motion) Who we gonna beat?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (stops) No -- you don't have to -- http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Oh. I thought... you lead me --

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: No. You don't do anything. I do it.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Oh. Good. She starts again.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Who we gonna beat? Who do we defeat? Who will we be pulverizing Into cream of wheat? Gradually, Buffy gets more into the cheer. The steps beco more complicated as she repeats the verse.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK'S HAND
dialogues.text: We see a knife slip out of Merrick's sleeve. He palms it, hands behind his back. In the middle of her routine, he hurls it at her. She cat it, reflexively, inches from her face. Stops dead. Then b into tears. Merrick is thrown off by this reaction.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Oh, what the hell is wrong with you? You threw a knife at my head!

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: I had to test you.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: But you threw a knife at my head!

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: And you caught it! Only the chosen one could have done that.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: I don't want to be the chosen one, okay? I don't want to spend the rest of my life chasing after http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer vampires! I just want to graduate from high school, go to Europe, marry Charlie Sheen and die. It may not sound too exciting toa sconehead like you, but I think it's swell. And then you come along... and... and then I'ma member of the hairy mole club, so you throw things at me! She is coming at him now. He begins to back up.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: It was necessary.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (realizing) Last night. You knew I was sitting on a fresh grave, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: I don't think you understand the full implications of -- Buffy punches him in the face. He goes flying a good ways lands on his back. His nose bleed merrily. Buffy stops.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: (getting up) Don't you see what's happening? You're changing. You've got powers you've only just begun to tap. Physical, mental prowess you've never dreamed of. (pulling a handkerchief out of his pocket) God, this hurts. I've administered a few shocks to your system to start the adrenaline working. I'm sorry I have to take so many shortcuts in the training process.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Put your head back. http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Two days ago, would you have even hit me? Let alone so powerfully?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: No... I guess I would have gotten Jeffrey to hit you.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Exactly. You're changing. You're becoming something extraordinarily powerful. Buffy looks at the knife in her hand. The MUSIC COMES UP we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy's period of training. Over the difficult course of she is obviously becoming more self-possessed, more at ea Her style of dress loosens a bit: a little punkier. Stops dying her hair blonde and her roots start showing. Accumu a few more holes in her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy charging some books: Lawson's Treatis on Demonology Psychological Interpretations of Vampirism, The Book of t Dead, and The Complete Garlic Cookbook.

dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Merrick sits on a crate, reading the obituaries and circl certain entries. Buffy stands on her head, sweating with concentration. Th CAMERA TILTS up to reveal her feet. Between the toes of o is a nail brush, with which she is very carefully paintin toenails.

dialogues.text: Amilyn and a few of the old-world vampires are on a spree trying on various leather jackets. As they cavort, the CA TRACKS behind the counter, where we find the clerk, blood dead, slumped on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy kissing Jeffrey goodbye after school. A long, linge kiss, during which she pulls away, anxious to get going. starts off, comes back and plants a big ol' on his lips o last time before splitting.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MINIATURE GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Merrick and Buffy are playing. Merrick tees off, shoots horribly.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (as announcer) Ooh, another embarrassment for the teabag, while the chosen one is still well under par.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Your turn. Buffy positions herself.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: What about bats? Do they turn into bats? http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: No. No bats, no flying. They... float, occasionally. Not really flying.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Toasty. Were there ever any, like, famous vampires?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Oh, several. Lucretia Borgia, Joseph Mengele, Franklin Pangborn... are any of those names familiar?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: If I say 'no' does that make me a bad person?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Good Lord. What do you study in history?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: My nails. She gives a little â€˜isn't that funny' kind of laugh. He d respond.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: All right. You've heard of the emperor Caligula, perhaps? Or Jack the Ripper?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: They were vampires?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Same one.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Oh. She considers this a moment. Tees off: another hole in on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Buffy and Merrick sparring, working their way in between "trees." She is his superior in speed and strength, but h easily trips her up. She glares at him from the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy late again. Gary Murray watches her from the hall, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two college-age guys stand hitchhiking. A red convertible pulls up, with a beautiful blonde behind the wheel. The g look at each other -- all right! They can't see her teeth the look in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy walks in, looks around. She approaches a PRIEST.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Yes, my child? Is something troubling you?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Well, sort of.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Well, maybe I can help.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Um... Could you bless these? She holds up a six-pack of Perrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer We see the entire cave, the still pool of blood, the torc lit. At the far end sits Lothos. In his arms is the body a dead girl. Blood stains her neck and yet the image is p reminiscent of Michelangelo's "Pieta". They are both perf still, her draped across his lap, he with his eyes far fa away. The silence holds. Lothos belches massively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrick is lecturing Buffy. Buffy is sitting, doodling in open notebook, "uh-huh"ing and obviously not paying atten

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Lothos was probably born in the eleventh or twelfth century; he's been difficult to trace. His power has increased with age. It will be a long while before you are ready to face him. We'll be lucky if we can get him to leave the area, to lie low for awhile. That will scatter the rest of them. Lothos is... He looks at Buffy, who is staring down at her notebook.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: (continuing) is extremely powerful, but he is still a vampire, and vulnerable to the same... He looks at her. Is she listening?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Daylight is still his enemy. The stake can still find his heart. Is she?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: (continuing) http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer I have huge antlers growing out of my buttocks. Nope. No reaction, just another "Uh-huh."

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY'S NOTEBOOK
dialogues.text: Merrick slams a stake right through the middle of it. Buf screams, jumps back a good two feet and lands on her butt

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (angry) What!?!

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Try to pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrick talking. Buffy drinking coffee, trying hard to st awake. Listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy in class, taking a test. Nicole leaning over, tryin cheat off her when she falls forward onto the desk, aslee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy being ushered into Gary Murray's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy sits in his chair. Gary moves about his desk, sitti behind it, leaning on it, talking to her. A FLY BUZZES annoyingly about his head.

dialogues.speaker: GARY MURRAY
dialogues.text: Well, I think we can safely say that something's going on with you, http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Buffy. Now, there's nothing to be nervous about; you're not in any trouble. I just hoped maybe we could talk. Don't think of me as Gary Murray, administrator. Think of me as Gary Murray, party guy! Happening dude who can talk to the young. Me and you. It's open... Tell me. It's drugs, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy stands under a tree, blindfolded. Merrick stands a apart, watching. Buffy stands very still, neck craned, wa Silently, a leaf falls. It wafts gently down. Buffy hurls knife at it with easy precision.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER TREE
dialogues.text: The knife stick deep into the trunk, the leaf perfectly p Merrick looks at it. Buffy smiles, knowing she has hit th target. Blindfold still on, she turns toward Merrick and into a branch, falls heavily backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

Buffy surreptitiously puts the push pin in her mouth.

dialogues.text: I guess you're surprised. well, you know, there's more to most people than meets the eye. Everybody's got a secret. I just want you to know that you can always share your secrets with me. What you say in this office, it will stay in this office. I'm your pal. Buffy smiles at Gary. As he looks away for a second, Buff spits out the push pin. The BUZZING STOPS.

dialogues.text: Buffy sparring with Merrick again. She holds a stake. Thi time she ends up pinning him, the stake at his solar plex He moves the point to where his heart would be.

dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.text: The sun! It burns! It burns! He laughs at his impression, brown spittle caking the win

dialogues.speaker: BENNY

dialogues.text: (continuing) "Feelings, la la la la feelings'... Boy, I'm helpless. She passes an alley and there is a RUSTLING amid the garb cans. She moves slowly down the alley toward the noise. S is about halfway down when a rat scurries out from the ca and down a drain.

dialogues.text: (continuing) Yeucch. Behind her, another SOUND. She turns slowly. At the entra to the alley stands a vampire. They stare at each other, thirty feet away.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer (continuing) What do you want? It floats rapidly at her, hissing. Buffy looks about her frantically, trapped. It hits her at top speed and she instantly rolls onto her back, flipping it and hurling it against the wall at the end of the alley. As it hits, Buf still rolling, produces a stake from her jacket and throw directly at its heart. The stake punctures the startled creature's chest. Before he can so much as grab it, Buffy throws a roundhouse kick, driving the stake all the way h with her foot. The vampire screams, sinks to the ground. Buffy turns, triumphant.

dialogues.text: (continuing) Toaster-caked him!

dialogues.text: He was slow. Very simple. They won't all be that easy.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.text: And the alley was a mistake. Never corner yourself like that. If they'd come at you in force you'd be dead now. One vampire is a lot easier to kill then ten.

dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Does the world 'Duhh' mean anything to you?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: You felt a little sick, didn't you? The cramps. They enter the warehouse.

dialogues.text: Nice conversationalist! Yeah, I felt 'em a little, but I ain't due for two weeks since you're so excited about the subject.

dialogues.text: It's natural. A reaction to their presence, to the... unnaturalness of it. It's part of how you are able to track them.

dialogues.text: You'll get used to it. I'm more worried about your tactical mistakes.

dialogues.text: You are such a wet.

dialogues.text: Don't start with me again.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Aren't I, like the chosen one? The one and only? The Grand High Poobah and doesn't that mean you have to be nice to me? Like, ever?

dialogues.text: Buffy...

dialogues.text: And why are you always wearing black? It's so down. t's totally not your color. I don't think you have a color.

dialogues.text: What do you want? Encouragement? (in bad American accent) "Gosh, Buffy, you're so special, I just want to give you a great big hug, oh I'm just having a warm fuzzy.'

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck you! Merrick turns on her.

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Do you know how many girls I've trained to be Slayers? Five. Five properly prepared girls, girls who faced their responsibilities, who worked hard to become women overnight -- harder than you've ever worked in your life -- and I saw them ripped apart. Do you want to live? Do you?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: What did you think, that being able http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Buffy looks at to jump about and hit people makes you a Slayer? him a bit.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Five?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: So, basically, I've got the life expectancy of a zit, right?

dialogues.text: Not if you're careful.

dialogues.text: How can you keep doing this?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: It's what I was raised to do. There aren't many of us left, the Watchers.

dialogues.text: Watchers?

dialogues.speaker: MERRICK
dialogues.text: There's a small village in Hampshire, near Stonehenge... (sees she doesn't know it) near a bunch of big rocks. That's where I was born. My father taught me about the training, about finding the Slayers, reading the signs. There's a small cluster of us, a few families, really... most of the neighboring villagers think we're just a bunch of harmless old loonies. I thought so myself for a time, when I was younger... (stops himself) I'm sorry. I'm not supposed to... I shouldn't go on like this.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: I wish you would. http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Silence.

dialogues.text: It isn't important.

dialogues.text: Buffy, don't... don't start thinking of me as your friend. It interferes with the work, and it...

He smiles at the other vampires, and raises fingers to his lips. Shhhh....

dialogues.speaker: A TABLE
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Pike is slammed down onto it, Benny's face inches from hi "Teen Angel" has been replaced by some hard rock.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Isn't this great, Pike? Isn't it great? Finally got those bitches on the run. He hoists Pike up and backhands him in the jaw, sends him against a wall. Pike shakes his head as Benny comes at hi again, no longer smiling.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Of course I'm angry! I leave you alone for five minutes, and look who you're hanging out with! He turns suddenly and grabs a girl, yells in her face.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: (continuing) I don't want girls with good taste; I want a girl that tastes good! She faints and he drops her, turns back to Pike. Pike is getting shakily to his feet. Blood trickles down his fore

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: (continuing) I was gonna change you, man. I was gonna give you life! Do you know what that means?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER WINDOW
dialogues.text: Gary Murray, yelling orders at student, holding a board a a window as vampires pound on it. The exposed part of the window above him shatters, raining glass on his head.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTO SETUP
dialogues.text: A vampire is clutching a helpless girl as another vampire their picture with an Instamatic. He expresses confusion dismay when his image does not come out in the photo.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE AND BENNY
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Pike is backing away from Benny, who is approaching him. passes an overturned table, the stubs of its broken legs sticking up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Never die. Never get kicked around, never get busted. Benny grabs him with hateful force. His fingers dig into arms enough to draw blood.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: (continuing) It means never having to say you're sorry! And you blow it all off for that slut?! What about my needs?! Pike suddenly grabs Benny, holds him tightly in a brother embrace. Benny is thrown slightly by this. Still holding him, Pike pitches onto the table, driving t leg-shard through Benny's back. Pike still holds Benny as twitches and screams, dying. Finally, he lets go, gets up He looks a little dazed, a little lost. A window shatteri far behind him pulls his eyes back into focus, and he goe help.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: Sitting by a wall, tiny and silent amid the carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy moves quickly along, crouching near a window and pe out. Nothing. She looks about her, waiting for an attack. She checks her purse.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY'S PURSE
dialogues.text: Cosmetics and hair spray. A small cross. No stakes left. Muttering under her breath, she moves swiftly into a clas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Still moving cautiously, she heads for the window and pul down the shade. She crouches behind the teacher's desk an pulls the chair down to her, laying it on its side.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: (cattily, to herself) â€˜Ooh, make me a woman, Jeffrey... oh, Jeffrey, you're so atheletical... I love you...' She slams her elbow down on the chair leg -- very control efficient motion -- and snaps it off. Looks around to see anyone is around to hear as she picks up the leg, now a w She goes softly to the door, peers cautiously out.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Looking out. Amilyn's face appears right next to her, als looking out.

dialogues.speaker: AMILYN
dialogues.text: All clear? Buffy screams, turns, and Amilyn decks her, sends her fly back into the classroom. The stake flies out of her hand. lands on a desk by the window. Buffy does not land nearly as well, crashing into a pile desks and twisting her leg badly. Amilyn laughs repulsive advancing.

dialogues.speaker: AMILYN
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you! Won't you guess my -- (kicks her hard) -- name?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (defiantly, through the pain) It wouldn't be 'Dick,' would it? He kicks her again.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (continuing) http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer 'Lefty'?

dialogues.speaker: AMILYN
dialogues.text: You're a fool, bloodbag. Die a fool and go to hell! He grabs her by the neck with his one arm and pins her ag the wall in the corner. She reaches for the stake but it just out of reach. He is squeezing the life out of her, h face inches from hers.

dialogues.speaker: AMILYN
dialogues.text: (continuing) The chosen one. You're just another bloodbag -- not even fit to die for the Master. When will you ever learn? Buffy looks about for succor.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDOW SHADE
dialogues.text: Buffy eyes the bottom of the shade, the pull dangling aim

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (with difficulty) I do know... one thing...

dialogues.speaker: AMILYN
dialogues.text: what?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: I know... what time sunrise is. She pulls down hard on the shade pull and lets go.

dialogues.speaker: AMILYN
dialogues.text: No! He turns in horror, letting go of Buffy, trying to catch shade. The instant he releases her, Buffy grabs the stake in one swift motion, buries it in Amilyn's back. The shade goes up, flapping loudly as it spins. It is sti pitch black out. Amilyn stare, wide-eyed and silent, at t night as he dies.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer It's in about four hours, Dick. Amilyn spins, dying rage in his eyes. He grabs her. His strength is formidable even as his body begins to smoke. Suddenly screaming, he forces her over suddenly with such that the two of them go crashing through the floorboards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them fall through the ceiling directly into th blood pool. Amilyn's body surfaces first, now just a husk. Buffy pops up from the waist-deep blood, soaked and wound She stays a moment, breathing hard. Suddenly her eyes go

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Oh, god, no... not yet... Lothos rises from the pool, smiling. Buffy is clearly par by fear.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come. He moves toward her.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: (continuing) You knew it, too, didn't you? All your life, dreaming... waiting to feed me. Buffy is suddenly galvanized into action. She throws a fe punches at Lothos, but he takes them without flinching. S grabs at the stake in what remains of Amilyn's chest. Lig quick, Lothos closes his hand around her and squeezes til stake splinters and she screams with pain. He knocks her on her ass. She starts moving backward, away from him, but it is hard for her to make her way through the thick gore. Lothos contemplates Amilyn's corpse, and his face darkens.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer (continuing) Ah, my fool is dead. He was careless, always. Still, I'll pull out your tongue for that. (coming toward her) Don't you understand? I've killed you a dozen times. Your life is not a blink of my eye, not a single breath. I have lived in the shadows, in the pulsing filth behind men's eyes. A thousand years, and more. I have conversed with the worms that fed on my corpse and I have bathed in the blood of emperors.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (breaking the spell) Have you ever thrown up in the front row of a Richard Marx concert?

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: what? And she is up, turning to run. He is thrown momentarily b her insolence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he is on her the moment she emerges from the chamber, grabbing her by the hair and throwing her to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: You waste time. That is a sin. He kneels over her prostrate body. She is reaching franti into her purse. He runs his hand along her body, a gestur both lustful and disdainful.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: (continuing) You're even weaker than the others.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: I think you've forgotten something. She pulls out a small cross, holds it in front of him. He http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer snarls at it, then grabs it, his hand around her. The cro bursts into flame. He holds her hand onto it.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: This? This is you only weapon? Your puny faith?

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: No... With her other hand, Buffy holds up her hair spray.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: (continuing) my keen fashion sense. She squeezes it at him, the spray catching fire form the and whooshes a jet of flame right into his face. He screa letting her go and backing up. Hey, his head is on fire! Buffy turns and hobbles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lothos stumbles about, head all aflame, till he finally p into the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy comes out of the boiler room and hobbles along, mov as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: This is the suckiest party I have ever been to. It's not evena contest. She reaches a locked door that says "Gymnasium -- Authori Personnel Only". Puts her shoulder to it.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer As he pulls himself out of the pool, we are treated to a look at his new head. It is charred and torn almost beyon recognition. It is so inhuman looking, that we are almost surprised when it screams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREAM fills the hall. Buffy is still working on the metal door. She turns, wide-eyed, at the SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: We TRACK rapidly through the cave, through the boiler roo the hall. We're moving much too fast to be running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy pulls herself up through a trap door in the corner. Everything stops. For a moment there is silence. Buffy gets shakily up.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: Don't let her in! Don't let her in! Pike and the others see her. Pike and Andy run to her to

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: (continuing) They'11 kill us! Get her out! Gary Murray stops in front of Kimberly, takes her face in hand and lightly pops the back of her head against the wa Cross-eyed, she slides back down into comatic silence.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Are you okay? http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Get away from me! She pushes them away. Lothos crashes through the trap doo behind her, ugly and crazed. He picks her up, floating a two feet off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: You bitch! He hurls her the length of the room. She hits a locker, w opens, spilling out someone's notebook. The binder falls inside it is a plastic pen case with pens and pencils wit Buffy looks, by this time, like shit. She props herself u best she can, looks about her. There is nothing wooden, n sharp, within reach.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: (continuing) You would challenge me? Andy charges Lothos from behind. Pike tries to stop him, is too late, as Lothos grabs him by the face without even looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Buffy) I'll rip the flesh from your stinking bones! Squeeze Andy's head until we hear something crack. Lets h drop. Looks around at the cowed students.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: (continuing) I am a God! A God!

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: I am so sure. Lothos roars. Furious, he charges Buffy, his feet just sk the ground, racing toward her, violently fast, upon her.. She spins, on her feet in a flash, one quick motion. She thrusts her palm forward and stops him, cold, like Superm stopping a train, palm at his chest. http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Silence. Buffy looks directly into his eyes, the mad rict of his face. Lothos stops, almost wide-eyed, as he looks down at his c Sticking out of the middle of his chest is a small eraser a #2. He steps back, staring at Buffy. The expression on his ho face seems to have changed to one almost of respect. Her is unfathomable. Lothos smiles, graciously.

dialogues.speaker: LOTHOS
dialogues.text: It doesn't... hurt... as much as I had imagined. He falls gently to the ground. He's dust before he hits i Silence. One by one the vampires, stricken, slip out into night.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Kneeling by Andy's body. He gets up, and walks toward wha left of Lothos, warily keeping his eye on the spot. In th background we see Gary Murray, running out after a vampir

dialogues.speaker: GARY MURRAY
dialogues.text: Just a minute, you! I'm not finished with you! Pike kneels by the pile of dust with a pencil in it. Everybody is looking at Buffy. She stares back at the stu who cast her out. Turns and walks out. Pike follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the direct aftermath; the gym, police cars, people helping the wounded. Over this is the voice of a reporter

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The death toll now reaches twelve and a half in the tragedy of Hemery http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer High School. It was at the Senior Prom five days ago that the school was beset by a roving gang of crack- crazed gunmen. Survivors say some two hundred of the ruffians laid the school gym under a kind of siege, claiming several lives in the process. Said one administrator, "Things here will never be the same.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students walk, holding their books talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students passing notes, yawning, falling asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students window shopping, sucking on slurpies, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: A POOL
dialogues.text: SHOT FROM ABOVE, the blue water FILLING THE SCREEN. Kimbe dives gracefully into it, comes up on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kim climbs out and joins Jeffrey, Jennifer and a boy and we don't know. They are all in bathing gear, with fluores zinc on their noses.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: She was even crazier after that. I mean it, you wouldn't even have recognized her.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: Buf fy? http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer Jennifer nods. Kimberly wrinkles her nose in distaste.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: She didn't even hardly talk to anyone in school. All year. She didn't even go to the prom.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: I heard she got straight A's. Jennifer glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: JEFFREY
dialogues.text: (continuing) That's what I heard.

dialogues.speaker: KIMBERLY
dialogues.text: The worst is, her parents -- this is true -- her parents were gonna send her to the Bahamas for graduation, and she refused. True story. She said she didn't want to go. It is to vomit.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Well, where is she now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buffy and Pike are walking up the elaborate stone drive t us. We can't really tell where they are, but there are tr hills in the background. Buffy leads the way. She is confident, at ease. She wears large old sports jacket, a baseball cap pulled backward. and sneakers. Casual, cool, but disarming. She carries a knapsack.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: I didn't say it was a bad idea, I just said the timing was off. We could maybe wait till later.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Don't be such a fraidy-cat. http://www dailyscript.com/scripts/buffy_the_vampire_slay  Buffy, the Vampire Slayer

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: Who's afraid? Besides me, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: We've come all this way. We just have to check it out. I got a hunch.

dialogues.speaker: PIKE
dialogues.text: You're the boss, boss. I just thought maybe we should wait. Buffy stops at a large, elaborately carved door. She turn Pike.

dialogues.speaker: BUFFY
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR KNOCKER
dialogues.text: Buffy grabs the large metal knocker, ringed through a gar mouth. And on the boom of the knocker, we see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The castle. Archetypal, turreted, terrifying. Standing lo on the craggy hill, drenched in the light of the rising m BLACK OUT.

dialogues.speaker: THE END
